instruction: Heat olive oil and butter in a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms, cook until golden brown, about 10 minutes.
Add arborio rice, stir to coat with oil and butter, cook for 1 minute.
Pour in white wine, let it evaporate almost completely.
Begin adding vegetable broth, 1 ladleful at a time, stirring constantly, letting each addition absorb before adding more.
Simmer for 18-20 minutes, or until rice is tender but still slightly firm.
Remove from heat, stir in parmesan cheese, chopped thyme, salt, and pepper.
Serve immediately, garnished with additional parmesan cheese and fresh thyme.
